choices.text: Who is this?
Whoa. Is this an actual person?

act1_introductions_004.text: Is this thing receiving? Can you hear me?

choices.text: I can read you. This is showing up on my computer. Who is this?
I can read you. This is showing up on my computer. Who is this?

act1_introductions_005.text: This is... I can't believe it.

act1_introductions_006.text: I thought I was out of anyone's range, but if it accepted a signal from you...

act1_introductions_007.text: Okay. This is on your computer, you said? What computer?

choices.text: Maybe you could tell me who you are first? I shouldn't even have connectivity on this thing.
choices.shortText: Maybe you could tell me who you are first?

choices.text: Total stranger talking through my computer? I'm pretty sure my parents would disapprove of this type of scenario.

act1_introductions_008.text: Fair enough. Let's trade that info.

act1_introductions_010.text: What are you seeing this on?

choices.text: An old cathode-ray tube computer. It's a project I pulled together from thrifted tech. Just tinkering. I can't even hitch it up to the internet, so I have no idea how I'm receiving you.
A dinosaur computer. It's a load of scrap I pulled together from old junk and thrift stroes. Just messing around. I can't even hitch it up to the internet, so I have no idea how I'm receiving you.

act1_introductions_011.text: Yeah, I'd like to know that too.

act1_introductions_012.text: Well, you're speaking English. Where are you, regionally?

choices.text: The States.
Earth.

act1_introductions_013.text: I'm not in the US. Greenland.

act1_introductions_014.text: Wild. Me too. I'm pretty far north, in Greenland.

act1_introductions_015.text: I suppose it's not so unbelievable that we're communicating somehow. That's what the chip was made for, after all.

act1_introductions_016.text: What do I call you, then?

choices.text: My name is [].
I'm pretty sure not providing personal info to strangers on the web is the first rule of the modern age.

act1_introductions_017.text: You know me now, don't you?

choices.text: True. My name is [].
Is "Prosper" an honest given name?

act1_introductions_018.text: Yes. It's exceptionally ironic, but it's mine. And yours is...

choices.text: My name is [].

act1_introductions_020.text: I don't want to assume anything. What's your preferred pronoun?

choices.text: He
She
They

act1_introductions_021.text: Got it. Good to know more than "text tinning up my quiet space."

choices.text: Wait, you lost me. Do you see this as text, too? I'm typing.
Yeah, not a fan of that as a nickname. Do you see this as text, too? I'm typing.

act1_explanations_001.text: You're connected to my chip somehow. It's a communicator in my head.

act1_explanations_002.text: I don't hear or read you. It's sort of like...another train of thought.

act1_explanations_003.text: You shouldn't be able to ping it. It's been dead for months.

choices.text: Dead? What happened?
Okay. Wow. You have a chip in your head? How did that happen?
Yeah. If you knew it was broken, why not fix it?
No, to you.

act1_explanations_006.text: I got dinged up pretty badly, I guess. I'm fine now.

act1_explanations_007.text: The chip isn't meant to be doing anything right now. That's why no one bothered repairing it. I guess now no one needs to.

choices.text: What else can the chip do?
choices.shortText: What else can the chip do?

choices.text: Right. And why exactly do you have a chip in your head?
choices.shortText: Why exactly do you have a chip in your head.

act1_explanations_008.text: Let's call that a need-to-know situation.

choices.text: You don't say...
Uh, I bet it is. Was it: A) Seedy corporation, B) Aliens, or C) Cool futury tech?
choices.shortText: Uh, I bet. Can I guess?

act1_explanations_010.text: Look, you don't want the details, []. When I say "long story," that implies brutal, uncomfortable, and dangerous to know.

choices.text: Okay, sorry to pry. I don't get any backstory?
So, mystery guy. Can I ask what happened?

act1_explanations_011.text: Look, you don't want the details, []. When I say "long story," that implies brutal, uncomfortable, and dangerous to know.

choices.text: Okay, sorry to pry. I don't get any backstory?
Okay, fine. I'm going to assume "all of the above," though.
So, mystery guy. Can I ask what happened?
Well, can you at least give me a hint at what happened?
You don't say...
Uh, I bet it is. Was it: A) Seedy corporation, B) Aliens, or C) Cool futury tech?
choices.shortText: Uh, I bet. Can I guess?

act1_explanations_014.text: Look, you don't want the details, []. When I say "long story," that implies brutal, uncomfortable, and dangerous to know.

choices.text: Okay, sorry to pry. I don't get any backstory?
So, mystery guy. Can I ask what happened?

act1_explanations_015.text: Look, you don't want the details, []. When I say "long story," that implies brutal, uncomfortable, and dangerous to know.

choices.text: Okay, sorry to pry. I don't get any backstory?
Okay, fine. I'm going to assume "all of the above," though.
So, mystery guy. You really won't tell me what happened?
choices.shortText: You really won't tell me what happened?

choices.text: Look, I'm sorry for prying. It just seems important that I know what happened.
choices.shortText: Sorry. It just seems important to know what happened.

choices.text: Yeah. If you knew it was broken, why not fix it?
No, to you.

act1_explanations_019.text: I got dinged up pretty badly. I'm fine now.

act1_explanations_020.text: That's why no one bothered repairing it. I guess now no one needs to.

choices.text: What else can the chip do?
choices.shortText: What else can the chip do?

choices.text: Just who might have repaired it?

act1_explanations_021.text: Why were you tinkering with scrap?

choices.text: I wanted to teach myself a little something about building tech. Starting way back when, with a cathode-ray tube computer.
I get bored. I figured it would be neat to put one of those cathode-ray tube computers together.

act1_explanations_023.text: Tinkering for its own sake, then.

act1_explanations_024.text: You sound like a lot of people I know.

choices.text: Is that a good thing?
Does that mean we can be friends?
choices.shortText: Does that mean we can be friends?

choices.text: I suppose I understand keeping things close to the vest. But where do we go from here?
All this redacted info is really supporting the "seedy corporation" vibes, you know. Where do we go from here, then?
We're mysteriously connected via an ancient computer and a crazy brain chip. I'd like to know why, but it doesn't seem like that's possible. So I don't see what else we can do here.
We're mysteriously connected via an ancient computer and a crazy brain chip. You're not being too helpful in connecting dots, so I don't see what else we can do here.

act1_explanations_027.text: Am I that bad a conversationalist?

choices.text: Not at all. This has been interesting, to say the least.
TBD.

act1_explanations_029.text: Okay. You could say...I'm in a bit of a bind.

choices.text: Trouble? What can I do to help?
I sense a bad "all tied up" pun coming. Evil corporation/government agency? I knew it.
choices.shortText: All tied up, huh? I knew it.

act1_explanations_030.text: Thank you, []. That you're even willing to listen... It means a lot.

act1_explanations_031.text: No, [], you don't know. And there's no reason you should.

act1_explanations_032.text: Look, if you want to sign off, then sign off. I'm used to the silence.

choices.text: Wait, I'm sorry. I don't want to sign off. So, the bind. Is it something I can help with?
I don't want to sign off. I want to know more. So, the bind. Is it something I can help with?

act1_request_001.text: Maybe there is something you could do.

act1_request_002.text: There's a message I need to deliver. It would be best if you didn't leave an electronic trail, so if you could write a letter to someone, I could rest easy.

choices.text: I can do that! Why can't you, though?
Snail mail, huh? If I remember how to send a letter, I will. Any reason you can't, though?

act1_request_005.text: Nothing I would manage to send would remain private.

choices.text: That's tough. I'll do what I can, but it won't really remain private this way, either.
Well, if you want me to pen a letter for you old school, it's not going to be private anyway.

act1_request_007.text: I don't know if this is wise after all. For your own sake.

choices.text: What could happen?
Let me worry about my own sake.

act1_reveal_002.text: It could be dangerous for you because...

act1_reveal_003.text: Well, I suppose there's no hiding it anymore.

act1_reveal_005.text: It's not as it seems, and there's a lot going on here I don't think you would understand.

act1_reveal_006.text: But you should know that I'm in a prison. Of sorts.

choices.text: Oh. Well. That's odd. Let me think.
I'm thinking.

act1_reveal_008.text: By all means, take your time.

choices.text: Did you do it? Whatever you're in for?
You have to realize I'm going to ask what you did to end up in prison.

act1_reveal_010.text: I did what I thought was right. I didn't hurt anyone, and I definitely don't want you to get hurt, [].

choices.text: Okay. I guess you don't seem to have a reason to lie. I'll write this letter. But I won't promise to send it, if I think it would upset someone.
That's...pretty vague. I'll write this letter, Prosper. But I'm not promising to send it until I know more.

act1_reveal_011.text: I suppose I can't ask for more. Thanks, [].

act1_reveal_012.text: All I want to do is wish someone goodbye.

choices.text: I've got paper and pen with me. Whenever you're ready.
Okay. Paper, pen. Let's go.

act1_reveal_013.text: Thought-to-text won't be the most elegant method, but it's better than what I had before.

act1_reveal_015.text: It will take me a minute to get this together.

choices.text: Take your time.
I've got nowhere to be.

act1_reveal_017.text: Damn it. [], I have to disconnect. I'll have to...

act1_reveal_018.text: I don't know. Ping me again in a few hours.

choices.text: Whoa, whoa. Are you okay?
Whoa, whoa. What's going on?
Connected! Hello?? Prosper?
Finally! Prosper?

act1_letter_002.text: I wasn't sure I'd get the signal back.

choices.text: The computer freaked out and shut down. I reconnected as soon as I could. Are you okay?
The computer freaked out and shut down. I reconnected as soon as I could. What happened?
Prosper?
Hello?

act1_letter_004.text: Sorry. I'm fine. Running...a little slow.

act1_letter_005.text: How long has it been since we first spoke?

choices.text: It wasn't that long ago. A few hours passed.
It's been a few hours.

act1_letter_006.text: Okay. Not as bad as I thought.

choices.text: Should I be worried?
Party too hard?

act1_letter_009.text: Still willing to help me with that letter, []?

choices.text: I am.
Sure. Let's compose some correspondence.

act1_letter_011.text: I didn't get the chance to put much thought into it, but maybe I don't need to.

choices.text: Go on.
Got it.

act1_letter_015.text: First off, do not set out to find me.

act1_letter_017.text: Grace, everything ended in a rush after the Harlem bust. There wasn't anything you or I could do. TUR was prepared for every eventuality.

act1_letter_018.text: So, they have me. That's the ugly fact. We're right back to the beginning.

act1_letter_019.text: But that doesn't mean you should try to get me recommissioned. It won't work, even if you could still contact TUR.

act1_letter_021.text: Damn it. I'm not sure this is a good idea, [].

choices.text: It's okay. This sounds heavy, and it's a weight you probably need off your shoulders.
To reach out to this Grace person for the express purpose of telling her not to reach back?
It's okay. This sounds heavy, and it's a weight you probably need off your shoulders.
choices.shortText: No, it is a good idea.

choices.text: Can I assume Grace thinks you might be dead?

act1_letter_023.text: Yes. I thought if I had the chance to get word to anybody, it would be to her. To say goodbye.

act1_letter_024.text: Let her know there's nothing to be done. Warn her, maybe, in case there's cause for it.

act1_letter_025.text: I have a feeling she didn't heed my warning to keep herself safe when I left.

choices.text: Well, keep going. This sounds heavy, and it's a weight you probably need off your shoulders.
Can I assume....Grace was a paramour of yours?
Right. Sorry. Well, keep going. This sounds heavy, and it's a weight you probably need off your shoulders.
Assumption retracted. Well, keep going. This sounds heavy, and it's a weight you probably need off your shoulders.

act1_letter_027.text: You know, that's an analogy I never got around to understanding.

act1_letter_028.text: Never mind that, though. You really think this is the right thing to do?

choices.text: I do. It's time for some cathode-ray tube Skype therapy.
I don't know about right, but you've already convinced me to help you this far.

act1_letter_029.text: Right. She deserves this, at least. Once more, with feeling.

act1_letter_030.text: It really was an honor to work with you. In time, I think we would have been honest friends. I regret not getting the chance to find out.

act1_letter_031.text: It's over, though. This is to make certain you know that. It's also to make certain you cleared any data caches I left behind. Keeping that data is dangerous.

act1_letter_032.text: That's it. I think. Should I end on a better note?

choices.text: I mean, if she's important to you, maybe she deserves a bit of hope.
I mean, if it's from the heart, it's from the heart. I'll write this up.

act1_letter_034.text: Grace, despite everything...I think I'll be okay. In some way or another.

act1_letter_035.text: And all the better for having known you.

choices.text: That's beautiful, Prosper. I'll write this up.
You've got me tearing up over here, Prosper. I'll write this up.

act1_letter_037.text: I guess it's time to send it.

act1_letter_038.text:
Grace Dillon
 1765 11th Ave
 New York City, NY

choices.text: NYC, huh? Okay, I'll send this.
NYC, huh? I'll send this. After I look up how much postage I need. I don't suppose you'll reimburse me?

act1_letter_040.text: This is such a relief. Thank you, []. Really.

act1_goodbye_001.text: Now... You may not like the sound of this.

act1_goodbye_002.text: But staying connected to this chip could endanger you.

choices.text: Whoa, whoa. What if you need help in the future?
I'm getting a martyr-y vibe from you, Prosper.

act1_goodbye_003.text: Sweet of you to worry. But I'll be okay.

act1_goodbye_004.text: What can I say? It's a style.

act1_goodbye_005.text: You see where I'm going with this don't you?

choices.text: Yeah, you want me to be safe. Or at they very least, hoard all the danger for yourself.
Yeah. You're ghosting me. And I thought we had a connection...

act1_goodbye_007.text: I'm not sure I even know how to unpack that.

act1_goodbye_009.text: I think you should dismantle the computer.

choices.text: If I really have to... Is it really that bad?
HOLD UP. Do you know how long I had to dumpster dive and thrift lift to get this thing together?

act1_goodbye_011.text: It would be the best way to ensure your safety, [].

act1_goodbye_012.text: I know you're proud of it, and you should be.

act1_goodbye_013.text: That said, I'd encourage you to look up "hubris."

act1_goodbye_014.text: Look, if there's one thing I need in here, it's peace of mind.

act1_goodbye_015.text: I don't want you to pay the price for helping me.

choices.text: I understand. I don't like it, but I understand. Thanks for looking out for me.
I mean, I don't really want to pay for that either.
Yes. I guess this is goodbye, Prosper.
Are you sure, though?

Okay. I trust your judgement.
 It was nice to meet you, Prosper.

This is me...signing off, then.
 In 60 seconds. A last minute, just in case you change your mind.
choices.shortText: But if you change your mind...

choices.text: Okay. I guess this is goodbye, Prosper.
There's really nothing else I can do to help?

act1_goodbye_019.text: You've done more than enough. I couldn't possibly repay you.

act1_goodbye_020.text: But I'll start by disconnecting the chip.

choices.text: Okay. I guess this is goodbye, Prosper.
No way! I can still help you, Prosper.
choices.shortText: No way! I can still help.

choices.text: This is []. But I talked to Prosper.
Who is this, and how do you know Prosper?

act1_grace_005.text: The better question is how you know him.

act1_grace_006.text: I traced the signal back here...

act1_grace_007.text: Never mind. Can you get ahold of him again?

choices.text: I could try. But who is this?
Last time I cooperated with a stranger on this computer, things got weird.

act1_grace_008.text: This is Detective Grace Dillon. NYPD.

choices.text: Oh. I'll get on it.
Okaaay. One sec.
Hi, Prosper.
Don't be mad.

act1_grace_and_prosper_002.text: I seem to remember telling you to dismantle the computer.

choices.text: You did. But I didn't want to take away your only link to the outside world!
choices.shortText: I didn't want to abandon you!

choices.text: You did. But I for sure did not listen.
Wait! Hear me out. I kept the computer together just in case. And there's a case. Detective Dillon.
Wait! There's someone here you probably like more than me. Detective Dillon.
She doesn't seem like the type to quit. I think she hacked me.
Try telling her that! She hacked me!

act1_grace_and_prosper_008.text: Prosper. What the hell is wrong with you?

act1_grace_and_prosper_011.text: I'm not going to drag you back into it.

act1_grace_and_prosper_012.text: It's over when I say it's over.

act1_grace_and_prosper_013.text: You saved my life. I'm not going to let you get killed.

act1_grace_and_prosper_015.text: There's nothing more I can say to you. I'm disconnecting.

act1_grace_and_prosper_017.text: You're not going anywhere until I get answers.

act1_grace_and_prosper_018.text: I don't have answers to give.

choices.text: Yeah. Not much I can do about it.
Just pretend like I'm not here.

act1_grace_and_prosper_021.text: I can't tell you that, Detective.

choices.text: Did you just go through my files?
Hey, ask before you go snooping around in my computer!

act1_grace_and_prosper_025.text: There's nothing either of us can do, Detective. Get yourself home, and please, deactivate []'s computer.

act1_grace_and_prosper_026.text: Please. I don't want anyone else to get hurt because of me.

act1_grace_and_prosper_027.text: That's exactly why I have to help you.

act1_grace_and_prosper_030.text: I'm pretty sure there's some philsophy about that last one.

act1_grace_and_prosper_031.text: You're a good person, Prosper. Better than most.

act1_argument_002.text: If you reboot again, I'm gonna track you down just so I can hit you.

act1_argument_003.text: Detective, you know why you can't help me.

act1_argument_005.text: It isn't worth endangering real lives for a simulated one.

act1_argument_007.text: If you just let me in on what's going on, I can help.

act1_argument_008.text: I'm not a person, Detective. I only look like one.

act1_argument_009.text: I understand your desire to help. My appearance was designed to ease humans into a sympathetic state.

act1_argument_011.text: You are no longer obligated to prevent damage to this unit.

act1_worth_saving_001.text: Explain what you did on the roof in Harlem, Prosper.

act1_worth_saving_003.text: If you're just a machine, if your emotions are part of a11 program, then explain that mission to me. The people you saved.

act1_worth_saving_005.text: The way you constructed theories, you liked building on assumptions. So let's assume.

act1_worth_saving_006.text: Let's assume I'm not going to stop until I find a way to help you.

act1_worth_saving_008.text: Let's assume I'm going to get you out of there.

act1_worth_saving_009.text: Once you start by telling me what I need to know.

act1_worth_saving_013.text: I saw that you had [] send me a letter. You wouldn't have contacted me if there wasn't some part of you that wanted help.

act1_worth_saving_019.text: Except you learned to want more.

act1_worth_saving_020.text: You don't have to give up.

act1_worth_saving_021.text: I don't know. I don't know what to do.

act1_worth_saving_022.text: Then help me figure it out.

act1_worth_saving_023.text: Where are you exactly? What do you see?

act1_worth_saving_025.text: Thank me later. Now, what do you see?

act1_situation_003.text: I can only communicate with you because it comes discretely through the communicator chip.

act1_situation_004.text: I think I'm in a workshop.

act1_situation_006.text: What are they doing to you?

act1_situation_008.text: Judging by the tests, they're trying to build a new model.

act1_situation_009.text: Searching for faults and weak points.

act1_situation_010.text: They didn't fix my arm. They removed it, capped it by the shoulder where it was damaged.

act1_situation_012.text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have believed them. I shouldn't have let them take you.

act1_situation_014.text: What were you going to do? Abduct me from a billion-dollar corporation?

act1_situation_016.text: I could have tried. After you saved my life, I owed you that much.

act1_situation_019.text: No. I don't think so. Sensitivity is pretty weak, but judging by the pressure, there are braces bolting my legs down.

act1_situation_020.text: I'm hooked up to something. They can't read the chip activity, or they would have disabled it by now. They must just be reading processor activity.

act1_situation_021.text: Okay. No sight, sound, smell. No movement. Down a limb.

act1_situation_023.text: When they come back, keep us updated. We'll assess from there.

act1_situation_024.text: Not the best plan, I know, but I'll keep working on it.

act1_situation_025.text: Have they interrogated you at all? Can you tell what they want from you?

act1_situation_026.text: They ask me to self-test. They ask me nonspecific questions, usually about New York or missions.

act1_situation_028.text: I answer. In New York, I could redirect commands away from my core processor. It was part of adapting my matrix. Here...

act1_situation_029.text: Well. It's like getting hit with a truck every time they want something from me.

act1_situation_030.text: Okay, okay. A lot to process. I'll be back.

act1_situation_032.text: There's sensitive information [] shouldn't see. Clear the messages.

choices.text:
For the record, I don't think she can. And I was reading along the whole time.
 Sounds like you're in a lot of trouble. And it also sounds like you're a robot.
choices.shortText: Sounds like a pretty serious situation.

choices.text:
As if I wasn't eavesdropping the entire time.
 Soooo...a ROBOT?

act1_information_002.text: No, I'm not a robot. Nothing so simplistic.

choices.text: Of course not. You're amazing.
Mechanical- American?

act1_information_004.text: But it's nothing for you to concern yourself with.

act1_information_006.text: And it's nothing for you to concern yourself with.

choices.text: Still gone. In the meantime...know any good icebreakers?
Here. I need your specs so I can find the records.

act1_information_008.text: I don't think there is such a thing.

choices.text: If you insist. We'll just...twiddle our respective thumbs. For who knows how long.
Well, is some information too much to ask?
choices.shortText: Can't I ask for some info?

act1_information_011.text: But this situation is highly dangerous.

act1_information_012.text: When that information could be dangerous to you, yes.

act1_information_013.text: You shouldn't know more than you absolutely need to.

choices.text: Life is dangerous. I'm involved now, and I should know what's going on.
choices.shortText: I'm in it now. You can trust me.

choices.text: You really think it's not too late for that?
choices.shortText: It's a bit late for that...

act1_information_015.text: It's fair for you to want to know.

choices.text: Definitely good information to have. Thanks for telling me. Wait â€” does that mean there are 412 models?
Give me a minute to get past "wow." Which brings us to: are there 412 models??

act1_information_018.text: 412 is the employee code. I'm their ninth design.

act1_information_019.text: I don't know if the previous eight even made it to the prototype stage, or if those projects were even androids.

choices.text: Yes, I'm good.
Well, no, but my dozen other questions can wait.

act1_information_022.text:
Class: Prototype 286
 Model 412-009 Mark-1
 Unit Dictation: Prospero

choices.text: So, I know that was absolutely a low blow. Apologies.
Okay, I want you to know how thrilled I am to be the second half of a successful Turing test. 10/10 would be fooled again.

act1_information_024.text: You must be joking. And yet, this is not a laughing matter.

choices.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I just wanted to know what I'm getting into here. Like...412? Are there that many models?
Not laughing. But I did need more information than you were giving me. Does that mean there are 412 models?
choices.shortText: Maybe not, but I needed to know.

act1_information_025.text: I want you to know that I'm sighing right now.

act1_information_027.text: But it's fair for you to want to know.

act1_information_028.text: 412 is the employee code. I'm their ninth design.

act1_information_030.text: This sort of information could be dangerous to you.

choices.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I just wanted to know what I'm getting into here. Like...412? Are there that many models?
Well, now we've traded low blows and we're even. Does that mean there are 412 models?

act1_information_032.text: I want you to know that I'm sighing right now.

act1_information_034.text: 412 is the employee code. I'm their ninth design.

act1_information_035.text: I don't know if the previous eight even made it to the prototype stage, or if those projects were even androids.

choices.text: I'm going to try to keep my cool here. But this is absolutely fantastic.
choices.shortText: I'll keep my cool. But wow.

choices.text:
Okay.
 ANDROIDS!
 What else is at the mysterious agency? Death rays, alien corpses, advanced spacecraft, etc.?

act1_information_036.text: If I understand that phrase correctly, you've failed.

act1_planning_002.text: No dog. I have two canaries.

act1_planning_005.text: What have you got? Anything useful in your records?

act1_planning_006.text: Looking through them now. Sit tight.

act1_planning_007.text: My compliance is unfortunately literal, Detective.

act1_planning_008.text: Right, poor choice of words. Sorry.

act1_planning_009.text: This is mostly legal junk. They stressed the kill codes, in the event of catastrophic malfunction.

act1_planning_011.text: One is through a data port. The other is the removal of a component in your lower spine.

act1_planning_012.text: Or whatever equivalent of a lower spine you have.

act1_planning_013.text: If I was flesh and bone, you mean.

act1_planning_014.text: Your insertion for the kill port is almost certainly useless now.

act1_planning_015.text: As far as the component goes, that would effectively be pulling my plug.

act1_planning_016.text: It would separate my power source from the rest of my body. A rather intentional weak point, it seems.

choices.text: What are you getting at?
If I may interject, killing you seems like the opposite of what we want to do.
choices.shortText: Maybe we could avoid killing you?

act1_planning_019.text: Well, to borrow from dozens of movies, you could pull a "I'm hurt, get help" move. If you sabotage your own systems, someone would come to fix you.

choices.text: "Get help" sounds good. "Sabotage" sounds less good.
And then comes persuasive physical force?

act1_planning_020.text: That's if I can even access the component.

act1_planning_021.text: Range of motion is limited. My damaged arm isn't restrained, but it isn't useful, either. My legs and other arms are bound.

act1_planning_022.text: I should point out that I don't know if anyone is in the room with me now. All I have access to are dulled touch sensors.

choices.text: Maybe there's something I could do to help. Figure out a patch from my end to reboot your senses?
I believe this is what we in the biz call a pickle.

act1_planning_023.text: Is there something we can do from our end? Through the chip?

act1_planning_024.text: It's a nice thought, but my communicator chip doesn't have access to other processes. Or else they would have realized by now that it's online.

act1_planning_025.text: It still doesn't make sense that it's connected to your computer, [].

choices.text: I might know how, actually, after picking apart the hardware while we were disconnected.
choices.shortText: I might know the answer to that.

choices.text: About that. I was looking at the hardware while we were disconnected.
And, I picked up my processor from a junkstore that ships in from New York. Think it could be your tech?
choices.shortText: I think a piece of your tech is in my computer.

choices.text: And, I picked up my processor from a junkstore that ships in from New York. Not to embarrass you, but...you ever leave any spare parts lying around?

act1_planning_029.text: I was badly damaged on my last mission. I suppose when they came to retrieve me, TUR might have left something behind.

choices.text: Must be. Unless we're thinking pure kismet. Uh, TUR?
Happens to the best of us. Uh, TUR?

act1_planning_030.text: Taskforce for Upcoming Robotics. I gather they built the name around the acronym, and their headquarters to match.

choices.text: How's that?
Don't tell me...
That is just... That would be the coolest thing I've heard all day, except that I've heard a lot of cool things today.
The nerds will stop at nothing, will they?

act1_planning_033.text: I thought you might like it.

act1_planning_035.text: All right, sorry to break up the chat, but I'm making some headway here on a ticket to Greenland.

act1_planning_036.text: What? Dillon, that's far too dangerous.

act1_planning_037.text: We've been over this already. I'm coming to get you.

act1_planning_038.text: Need I remind you that Greenland is not the green one?

act1_planning_040.text: Even I wouldn't last long in subfreezing temperatures.

act1_planning_042.text: Get you out of that workshop, then out of that facility, then to me.

choices.text: Not to be a buzz kill, but there isn't a lot of detail in that plan.
And then, live long and...

act1_planning_043.text: I suppose it's as good as place as any to start.

choices.text: Not gonna finish the quote? All right then.
I was really hoping you would finish the quote.
choices.shortText: Are you gonna finish the quote?

act1_planning_045.text: For now, it's what we've got.

act1_planning_046.text: I'm not letting you go that easy, Prosper.

act1_planning_047.text: Detective. I don't know how to thank you.

act1_planning_049.text: And you certainly didn't teach me.
